entry.title: Rangers, Celtic & Glasgow City go for title LIVE: SWPL Helicopter Sunday
entry.summary: The Scottish Women's Premier League draws to a close this Sunday with three clubs still in with a chance of lifting the title we are in for a huge afternoon of action. Glasgow City, Celtic and Rangers can all still become champions, but who can hold their nerve? Stay tuned on our LIVE blog to find out.

entry.title: What channel is Rangers v Glasgow City? What channel is Celtic Women v Hearts? TV details for SWPL title deciders
entry.summary: One of Celtic, Rangers or Glasgow City will be crowned Scottish Women's Premier League champions on Sunday as an epic three-way battle for the title reaches a dramatic conclusion.

entry.title: SWPL final day: Glasgow City, Celtic and Rangers all set for title shootout - the numbers will add up for someone
entry.summary: There is no need for helicopters to change direction when the distance to Ibrox or Celtic Park is a simple hop, skip and a jump away. This afternoon’s motorbike outrider, however, would be better served with an abacus rather than a sat nav.

entry.title: Celtic reaction: Crowd drift telling; Lisbon Lions high still beatable; few cup final concerns
entry.summary: A dynamic St Mirren came close to giving Celtic a real bloody nose in the champions’ own backyard BY twice taking the lead before being pegged back in the clubs’ 2-2 draw. The encounter betrayed that Ange Postecoglou’s men are struggling to retain their edge post-title win and engendered some random musings.

entry.title: Celtic fans recall skipping exams and getting engaged in Seville
entry.summary: On the 20th anniversary of a historic event, the fans who were there share their stories and memories.

entry.title: SWPL promises to deliver final day drama
entry.summary: Three teams have a realistic chance of winning the title, and the women's domestic game may finally get its afternoon in the spotlight.

entry.title: Celtic transformed from Ferrari to jalopy in latest misfire
entry.summary: For a team that purports to never stop, Celtic are giving an awfully strong impression of having begun to grind to a halt.

entry.title: St Mirren manager Stephen Robinson in 'we deserved to win' claim following Celtic Park showing
entry.summary: St Mirren manager Stephen Robinson believes his players did not receive their just desserts for a fizzing display against the champions in their own backyard.

entry.title: Ange Postecoglou makes 'heavyweight champion of world' comment after questions over St Mirren draw
entry.summary: Celtic manager Ange Postecoglou accepted his team have deviated from their core principles following their struggles that required them to twice come from behind to dig out a 2-2 draw with a vibrant St Mirren.

entry.title: Ange Postecoglou in Celtic 'heavyweight champion' response to critics
entry.summary: Ange Postecoglou fired back at critics as Celtic failed to defeat St Mirren.

entry.title: Celtic 2 St Mirren 2: Instant reaction to the burning issues
entry.summary: dsak;dnas

entry.title: Celtic team news vs St Mirren as Postecoglou names starting XI
entry.summary: The Scottish champions are looking to get back on track after the defeat to Rangers.

entry.title: John Kennedy draws Man City parallels with Celtic under Ange
entry.summary: The Parkhead assistant is looking forward to another crack at the Champions League next season.

entry.title: Rangers CEO James Bisgrove has say on Celtic threat to most successful club in world status
entry.summary: It is an unenviable high wire act that James Bizgrove must perform as he steps into the role of Rangers chief executive.

entry.title: Seville memories and 'sensational' Man City whet Celtic's European appetite as champions prepare to return home
entry.summary: There should be a carnival atmosphere at Parkhead this afternoon as the majority of the Celtic support get their first chance to acclaim their freshly-crowned champions.

entry.title: What Liam Scales said about Aberdeen and Celtic future, pre-season plans and his 'love' playing for the Dons
entry.summary: As things stand, Liam Scales will report to Celtic for pre-season after taking a much-needed holiday following an Aberdeen season which has been somewhat of a rollercoaster.

entry.title: Ally McCoist brands Chris Sutton 'disrespectful' after Rangers dig
entry.summary: Ally McCoist has branded Chris Sutton 'disrespectful'.

entry.title: Kennedy says Rangers defeat is learning experience for Celtic squad
entry.summary: John Kennedy believes the defeat to Rangers last week will be a key learning experience for Celtic.

entry.title: Rangers lift lid on Graeme Souness talks and confirm 'maximum' Celtic away allocation next season
entry.summary: Graeme Souness has held “informal” talks with Rangers over the prospect of returning to the club in an ambassadorial capacity.

entry.title: St Mirren won't give Celtic guard of honour at Parkhead
entry.summary: The Buddies boss confirmed the decision was made at a higher level.

entry.title: Celtic fringe player 'agrees three-year contract extension'
entry.summary: Keeper Scott Bain has struggled for minutes and was expected to move on after Benjamin Siegrist's arrival in the summer.

entry.title: Celtic boss Ange Postecoglou, two Premiership rivals and title winner nominated for SFWA Manager of the Year
entry.summary: Ange Postecoglou is one of four nominees for the Scottish Football Writers’ Association’s Manager of the Year award.

entry.title: Celtic star set for surprise 3-year-deal as EPL duo target highly-rated defender
entry.summary: Celtic are set to hand goalkeeper Scott Bain a new three-year-deal despite not having featured this season.

entry.title: Callum McGregor on key difference for Celtic in next Champions League
entry.summary: The Parkhead skipper was in the youth academy when Martin O'Neill's iconic team reached the UEFA Cup final.

entry.title: Inside Callum McGregor's Celtic longevity - why no rest required ahead of the Scottish Cup final
entry.summary: He is one of the most relied upon players in Scottish football but you won't catch Callum McGregor asking for a rest.

entry.title: Inside Callum McGregor's Celtic longevity - why no rest required ahead of Scottish Cup final
entry.summary: He is one of the most relied upon players in Scottish football but you won't catch Callum McGregor asking for a rest.

entry.title: Barry Robson expresses away fan desire as Aberdeen to be backed by 600 at Tynecastle for Hearts clash
entry.summary: Aberdeen boss Barry Robson has called on Scottish clubs to “get together” regarding away supporters.

entry.title: Callum McGregor issues defiant Celtic response to Rangers defeat and James Bisgrove claims
entry.summary: Callum McGregor has no doubts that Celtic can maintain their status as the top dogs in Scottish football despite Rangers outlining plans to knock them off their perch.

entry.title: Celtic captain Callum McGregor bats away Rangers 'dominant team' claim
entry.summary: New Ibrox CEO James Bisgrove this week said the club had a plan in place to return to the top of Scottish football by 2025.

entry.title: Mulgrew responds to Dundee United critics over Celtic Hydro show
entry.summary: Charlie Mulgrew has responded to his Dundee United critics after his decision to appear at a Celtic charity fundraiser.

entry.title: Charlie Mulgrew breaks silence on Celtic Scott Brown event - 'my full focus is on Dundee United'
entry.summary: Charlie Mulgrew has stressed his appearance at Thursday night’s tribute event for his former Celtic team-mate and captain Scott Brown at the OVO Hydro in Glasgow will have no bearing on Dundee United's on-going battle to avoid relegation.

entry.title: Goodwin tells Dundee United fans to 'relax' after Mulgrew backlash
entry.summary: Jim Goodwin has urged Dundee United fans to relax over Charlie Mulgrew's decision to appear at a Celtic charity evening.

entry.title: Callum McGregor details Celtic 'hurt' after Rangers loss
entry.summary: Callum McGregor has been encouraged by the reaction of his team-mates to the pain of last weekend’s defeat by Rangers.

entry.title: Ex-Celtic boss Ronny Deila 'set to quit' as Standard Liege gaffer
entry.summary: Reports in Belgium suggest that the Norweigan is set to join league rivals Club Brugge after making a U-turn on his future.

entry.title: Jota trolled by Celtic mate Alistair Johnston over Benfica game time
entry.summary: The Portuguese winger was on the books of his boyhood heroes before venturing to Scotland in the summer of 2021.

entry.title: Rangers on verge of signing former Celtic target as talks reach 'crucial stage' but Jack Butland deal hits snag
entry.summary: Rangers are closing in on the signing Ecuador international Jose Cifuentes after holding talks with the player's representatives over the past week.

entry.title: Ex-Celtic striker Giorgos Giakoumakis scores chip in MLS
entry.summary: Ex-Celtic player Giakoumakis continued his great start in America, as he scored a chip in Atlanta United's win last night against Colorado Rapids

entry.title: Dermot Desmond spotted with Ange Postecoglou at Celtic Park
entry.summary: The Hoops majority shareholder's son, Ross, was also pictured taking part in the conversation in the foyer of Parkhead.

entry.title: Steven Gerrard Rangers record dug out by Barnes over Celtic grievance
entry.summary: The Liverpool and England legend believes that black managers are not afforded the same opportunities as those who are white.

entry.title: Celtic vs St Mirren: Live stream, TV channel & team news
entry.summary: It's now the Scottish champions' turn to play on home soil as they welcome St Mirren to the east end of Glasgow this weekend.

entry.title: Celtic transfer decision on Liam Scales on hold until the summer
entry.summary: The defender has been an impressive figure in the Dons backline this season, particularly since Barry Robson took over the side in late January.

entry.title: Ange in Celtic tribute to key duo he was determined to stick with
entry.summary: Ange Postecoglou may be the frontman, but the Celtic manager is adamant his backroom team deserve just as much limelight.

entry.title: The Ange Postecoglou 'boom moment' that kick-started success
entry.summary: There is a certain art to becoming comfortable in the uncomfortable - the Celtic boss is a master.

entry.title: Ange Postecoglou addresses Liam Scales' Celtic future and hails the 'outstanding people' behind his success
entry.summary: Celtic manager Ange Postecoglou has applauded Liam Scales’ efforts on loan for Aberdeen and revealed a decision on the player’s future is imminent.

entry.title: How Rangers plan to overtake Celtic as new CEO reveals strategy to become 'dominant club in Scotland'
entry.summary: New Rangers chief executive James Bisgrove has revealed that plans are in place for the club to become the dominant force in Scottish football across the next two years.

entry.title: Mum of Glasgow Rangers fan who died at 19 plans special tribute
entry.summary: An old firm charity match is set to take place this weekend in memory of a Glasgow teen who lost her life in 2020.

entry.title: Celtic v Inverness: MSPs demand more answers over Scottish Cup final kick-off change as SFA response branded 'less than satisfactory'
entry.summary: MSPs have written to the Scottish FA for a second time to demand more answers after being left “disappointed” with the response received to questions relating to the decision to change kick-off time for next month's Scottish Cup final between Celtic and Inverness Caledonian Thistle.

entry.title: Celtic transfers: 5 players linked with move to Scottish champions as Ange Postecoglou targets 'another level'
entry.summary: How do Celtic go to the next level? They are on course for the treble, following on from the double last season, and it is difficult to look at Ange Postecoglou’s strongest XI and pinpoint an area that should be upgraded or would be straightforward to upgrade.

entry.title: Celtic transfers: Ange Postecolgou admits 'players will move on' as 18-goal target addresses speculation
entry.summary: Celtic will be looking to complete a treble in the coming weeks but already there will be a focus on the summer and planning for their title defence but also the Champions League group stage where they will look to improve on from this campaign.

entry.title: Ex-Celtic boss Neil Lennon nears management return at Olympiakos
entry.summary: The former Parkhead manager is reportedly in the running to take over at the Greek giants.
